line.en: Once we began work on building the main wings,\nthe Soaring Club garage suddenly came to life.
Everyone had their own tasks, and was able to\nfind an outlet for their increased motivation.
This also had an effect on things outside the\ngarage too.
For example, at lunchtime one day...
'Hey, what's the difference between glass mats\nand glass cloth...?'
'The size. Were there any other differences?'
'Glass cloth is thinner, but the fibers are\nlonger, so it's stronger when pulled.'
'Oh, that's right.'
'So, when making the wings, glass cloth would be\nmore suitable.'
'So, when making the wings, glass cloth would be\nmore suitable.'
'They're big, wide, and also strong.'
'That's true.'
Recently, it's been like this, with Kotori and\nAgeha having lunch together.
Kotori is always reading an introductory book for\nFRP, and if there is anything that she doesn't\nunderstand, she asks Ageha.
When Ageha has free time, she is studying thick\ntechnical books about glider construction that\nshe took from the bookshelf in the garage.
She would even read while eating her lunch.
As Kotori spent more time with Ageha, she also\nbegan to feel more at home in the class. This\ncould be called a welcome byproduct.
'Hey, Aoi. Stop eyeing up the girls!'
'I-I'm not!'
I made a few friends from class too, and started\nhaving lunch with them sometimes.
'(Hmm... I wonder what they're talking about)'
As far as building the main wings goes, I can't\nbe of much help. I'm still interested, though.
Well, I mean, I wanna chat about the glider too.
'But you're doing well, aren't you?'
'Why's that?'
'Since you transferred, you've managed to get\nalong with Kotori, and even get close to\nMochizuki-senpai, haven't you?'
'It's all just by chance.'
Kotori used to have a difficult relationship with\nthe girls, but at least she's being treated\ndifferently by the boys.
They had found her a bit unapproachable but\nshowed a certain kind of respect when they spoke\nof her.
'Just by chance, huh?'
Since I became the dorm mother, maybe I've been\nspeaking about her with a similar respect.
'Ageha is the one who allowed me to settle into\nthe class so quickly, anyway.'
'I've gotta tell you this. We all envy you\nbecause of that too...'
'Whadya mean, you two were childhood friends!?'
'Yeah, it's true but...'
This is kind of off-topic, but it seems like\nAgeha is rather popular with the boys.
Somewhat predictably, some of the boys are a\nlittle jealous of my position.
I can hardly blame them - If the situation were\nreversed, I'd be envious of them.
'Yeah, I wanna join the Soaring Club too...'
'That's too bad. We're already full.'
'Bullshit, stop hogging all the girls to\nyourself, dude.'

In one corner of the classroom, Ageha and the
others were talking enthusiastically about
gliders. Contrary, the other boys and I
enthusiastically talked about typical high school
boy stuff.

Speaking of which, when I was at the all-boys
school, these kinds of conversations were a lot
less enjoyable. So, I'm glad I transferred after
all.
That's an average day for me now.
After school, we all head to the garage and\nengross ourselves in the work we have to do.
Ageha is also in the Robotics Club, so some days\nshe spends some time there. Once she's finished,\nshe shows her face at the Soaring Club.
Whenever she shows up, she checks up on Kotori's\nwork, and dishes critique...
'That's no good!'
or...
'Looks great!'
and so on.
Then, finally, a few days ago...
'Gently... Peel it off gently...'
'...Alright, we got it off!'
'Look, look, see?'
Kotori, having peeled the FRP plate from the\nmold, grinned as she held it out to show us.
'Alright!'
'You did it!'
'...Whew.'
Our elation at the success caused us all to punch\nthe air triumphantly.
The smooth surface revealed a glossy shine, as\nthe dim light of the garage shone across it.
This 200 by 40 centimeter plate was one of the\npieces that would become the main wings.
The main wings are eight meters long.
The pieces are made separately, since it's more\nprone to damage it's constructed as one. The\npieces are joined later.
'Hey, look at this, it's really smooth!'
'You're right. This is very different to when I\nmade it.'
'But, won't the connection point become weaker?'
'That's no problem. The place where it joins has\nmore layers, and is actually even stronger.'
'Now we polish it, and add the color, right?'
'We can connect them once they're all finished.'
'Hmm... So, it will still be a while before it's\ncomplete, then?'
The first plate was experimental, to prove that\nthe manufacturing process works.
Now we need to make ten additional, identical\nplates.
'It's so smooth already, does it really need to\nbe polished?'
'There's release agent on the surface. Iif we\ndon't clean it off, the paint won't adhere to it\nproperly.'
As Ageha explains, she checks all over the\nsurface of the plate.
'Yes, this is really well made!'
'Of course! I put in a lot of effort into this!'
'It really is well made... That's great...'
As we chatted among ourselves, standing before\nthe first result of our efforts, we all kind of\nfelt a sense of excitement and unity.
It was taking time, but we knew we would finish\nthe glider.
Sunday.
Tomorrow, our end-of-term tests will begin. So,\nall club activities have been stopped for the\ntime being.
If we secretly work on the glider and get busted,\nit could put the club in danger. So, we stick\nfirmly to the rules.
That's why we are meeting at the garage on\nSunday.
The cicadas are giving their delightful 'song' as\nloud as ever.
That's to be expected for this time of year, of\ncourse. It's now the peak of summer.
Once the end of term exams are over, our long\nawaited summer holiday can begin.
'Hey, Aoi!'
'Is that you, Amane-senpai?'
On my way to the school, I hear Amane-senpai\ncalling from behind.
'This is unusual. Are you alone?'
'I had some work at the dorm. The others couldn't\nwait, so they left without me.'
Early this morning, Ageha appeared at the\ndormitory. She took Kotori and left.
'Those two have been getting along well recently.\nGuess they finally opened up to each other.'
'You're right, when it's just the two of them,\nthey both look like they're having fun.'
'Yeah? In what way?'
They must be talking about the glider.
'They mostly talk about you.'
'Really? I wonder what kind of rumors they've\nbeen spreading about me...'
I can somehow imagine it and it would definitely\nbe something stupid.
'Do you want to know?'
'Nah, it's fine.'
Just knowing that those two are getting along is\nenough.
Besides...
'Hmm? What is it?'
'Well, you're not in your uniform today, Amane. I\nthink this is the first time I've seen you in\nsomething else.'
'Oh, you mean this? Yesterday, I went back home\nfor the first time in ages. I went to go and help\nmy dad with his job.'
'Your dad's job? What kind of job does he do?'
'He's an inventor.'
'An inventor...'

For a moment, I imagine a middle-aged man. With
big, thick glasses and a white coat, he talks in
a strange voice while pouring chemicals into a
test tube. An explosion follows.
It's not like the days of Edison. Now. it has\nbecome a proper profession.
'(...Wait a sec, she said she's been home for the\nfirst time in ages, so does that mean she usually\nlives alone?)'
I can't help but wonder, but it seems there could\nbe some family issues. So, I don't really know if\nI should ask.
'It's not just Kotori and Ageha, I've been having\nfun too.'
'What do you mean?'
'With the club.'
'Everyone's been great. Ageha is a genius when it\ncomes to making things. She's quick-witted and\nhas an abundance of knowledge.'
'Kotori is patient and keen. I think she wants to\nfly more than anyone.'
'Aoi, you do a good job of bringing those two\ntogether. You're already better than me when it\ncomes to the simulator.'
'If they heard you say that about them, they'd be\nreally happy.'
'You think so?'
'Yeah, I guarantee it.'
The reason why everyone can put so much into\nthis, without hesitation, is because someone\namazing like Amane is here.
Amane brushes back her long hair and smiles as if\nreminiscing about something.
'Ever since you guys came, the place has been\nbustling with activity.'
'It's like Isuka has returned.'
There's that name, Isuka, again.
The person who wrote the flight log.
What sort of person was she?
Also, why does Amane-senpai always talk about her\nin the past tense?
'Haha, I want to do another test flight soon.'
Amane looks off to the distance, at a big column\nof cloud. It's as if she can hardly wait.
'Wassup!'
'Wassssup!'
'Wh...what's up.'
'Huh, are you alone, Kotori?'
I enter the garage with Amane to see Kotori\nsitting alone in front of the air conditioner,\nlooking bored.
'If you're looking for Ageha, she was called away\nby one of the members of the Robotics Club.'
'Robot Club?'
Recently, Ageha has been coming to the Soaring\nClub more often than the Robotics Club.
Could that be the reason why they called for her?
'The person who came to get her had a looked\nreeeeeeeeeally serious.'
said Kotori lazily.
Her face also seemed to say, 'I don't even wanna\nthink about it'.
As Kotori spoke, Ageha returned.
'Hi, I'm back!'
'Hey, Ageha. Did you get called away by the\nRobotics Club?'
'Yeah, ahh...'
'What's wrong?'
'There was a bit of a problem. I should be happy\nabout it though.'
'...Well, I also have to think about how the\nseniors feel.'
'What happened?'
'...I have to focus on the Robotics Club for a\nlittle while.'
'What's that supposed to mean?'
'Amane, just for a little while, could you let me\ntake a break from the club?'
'That's fine, but...'
'You say 'a little while', but how long is that?'
'Until the start of the summer holidays at the\nearliest. At the latest, up until the Obon\nfestival...'
That's about halfway through our summer holiday.
'It's the qualifying round for the Robotics\nContest, isn't it?'
Ageha nods.
'The underclassman team that I'm a member of was\njust the reserve team, so there were no plans for\nus to enter but...'

'...it seems there was a problem with the
senior's robot, and they won't be ready in time.
So, all of sudden, it's been decided that we will
enter.'
The Robotics Club is really popular.
There are many members and they are divided into\nseveral teams, all trying to produce a robot that\nmeets the regulations for this year's contest.
According to Ageha, the juniors not only help the\nseniors with their work, but they also practice\nmake their own robots.

However, that's only for practice -- helping the
seniors is the priority. It seems that it's
usually time constraints that stop them from
finishing their robots, but...
This year, Ageha got really fired up, and said\nthey could do it anyway.

When the problem occurred with the seniors'
robot, they were no longer able to enter the
contest. It was decided that Ageha's team would
enter.
'So, what about making the gliders wings?'
'I won't have time to work on them directly...'
'I'll come round once I'm done with the Robotics\nClub, so could you do it, Kotori...?'
'Hmph! No way, I'm all by myself!'
'I'll help.'
If this means that the main wings can't be\ncompleted, now is not the time for me to be doing\npilot training.
'Yes, please.'
'I'm really sorry. Well then, I have to head back\nnow.'
Ageha made her apologies and left the garage.
There was an awkward silence in the garage.
'What is it with her? She just says whatever she\nlikes!'
'...She doesn't mean it. She was a member of the\nRobotics Club to begin with.'
'But things were going so well...'
'Senpai, while Ageha is away, can I help Kotori?'
'Huh? Y-...Yeah...'
'Senpai?'
'No, I think that'll be OK. Let's do that.'

Amane-senpai seemed kind of annoyed, then went
back to her usual spot, sitting in front of the
drawing board. After that, she didn't say
anything.

On the first day of the first-term exams, the
sunshine that we'd had for the last few days
changed quite unbelievably, into really heavy
rain.
This would be my first exam since I'd come to\nthis school.

I've never been against studying, so I felt quite
confident. However, when it came to the
specialist subjects, I struggled because I didn't
even know what kind of questions would come up.
'OK, time's up. Put down your pencils.'
The answer sheets were collected.
That's the end of today's exams.
'Go straight home, don't play about. You have\nexams tomorrow too.'
That's what the teacher said, but I had brought\nmy lunchbox.
'How'd you do, Ageha?'
'Well, it was OK.'
'I scraped through. I'm betting it all on\ntomorrow's English exam.'
'Ah ha ha, I'm no good at English.'
As always, Ageha was chatting with our\nclassmates. She grabbed her bag and followed them\nout the classroom.
'Ageha.'
I followed her out to the hallway and called out.
'Hmm?'
'Are you going home?'
'Yeah. There's something I need to do. How about\nyou?'
'I'm gonna swing by the garage.'
'I see.'
'Ageha, are you...'
'Ageha, what are you doing?'
'Sorry, you go ahead.'
'What is it, Aoi?'
'...No, nothing. See ya.'
'OK. I'll do my best in tomorrow's exam!'
She exclaimed this cheerfully, and waved her\ncolorful orange umbrella around as she chased\nafter her friends.
'Aren't you going with her?'
'Whoa... It's you Ma-bou. It doesn't matter, does\nit? Whether we leave together or not?'
'Yes it does matter! Lately, you guys have been\ntogether all the time. You're getting so clingy,\nit almost makes me feel sick!'
'We're not getting clingy.'
'You are! Yes, you are! You said something about\nthe something-or-other Club, didn't you?'
'What are you sulking about? The fact that you\ncan't join us?'
'Huh!? Who'd wanna hang out with you guys? Ptoo!\nPtoo!'
'Don't spit in the hallway.'
'I thought there was something strange going\non...'
'In the past, you confessed to Ageha, but she\nturned you down, didn't she?'
I felt myself stiffen unconsciously.
'...How do you know about that?'
'I heard it from Ageha.'
Why that little...
'Despite that, you're hanging out again. If you\nwere to ask someone who's experienced in romance,\nlike me, I'd say it was definitely strange.'
'Umm, I think you're a bit confused. That was\nback when we were kids...'
'K-Kotori! How long have you been there!?'
'I-I don't know! I didn't listen in or anything!'
She denied it in a really obvious way, then\nzoomed off down the hallway at top speed in her\nwheelchair.
'...Ma-bou, you asshole!'
'So long!'
'Hey, hold it!'
Masatsugu skips away as I try to retaliate.
'Hey, Kotori.'
'...I didn't hear anything. Even if you ask me\nabout what it was that I didn't hear, I won't be\nable to answer.'
'Is that so...?'
Going against what our teacher had said, Kotori\nand I headed towards the Soaring Club garage.
It'd been raining all day today, and the humidity\nin the garage was stifling.
Sitting down in front of the air conditioner, we\nopened up the textbooks for the subjects for\ntomorrow's exams while we ate our lunch.
'(...Damn you, Ma-bou.)'

The thing that Ma-bou had let slip just now
really was something that happened when we were
just kids. I think that Ageha has probably
forgotten all about it.
Even if she did remember, there are many other\nembarrassing or uncomfortable memories she could\nuse.
At that time, we didn't really understand the\ndifferences between boys and girls, and you could\nsay they were 'youthful indiscretions'.
That's why I don't think it has any special\nmeaning.
'Amane, how was the exam?'
'Hmm? I didn't take it.'
That's right, she's deliberately dropping\ncredits.
Also, if she took the test like everyone else,\nshe's so smart that she'd be top of the class\nwithout even trying.
By the way, strangely, Amane isn't hungry today,\nso it seems that the lunchbox I brought for her\nwill go to waste.
I'll put it in the fridge, so she can eat it\nlater when she gets hungry.
'Yes?'
'...It's about Ageha.'
'What's this? I thought you weren't listening.'
Kotori ignores my sarcasm as she continues.
'You were talking with her in the hallway.\n...What was she saying?'
'Oh... Nothing really. She said she had to do\nsomething and went home.'
'Don't you think that Ageha is avoiding us? She's\nnot coming here either...'
Since Ageha said that she was going to focus on\nthe Robotics Club, she hasn't come to the garage\nonce.
'Well, club activities are suspended during the\nexams. Aren't we the ones breaking the rules in\ncoming here?'
'Perhaps...'
'Hey, I guess that thing...'
'Yeah...'
The truth is, it was annoying me, so I asked\nsomeone I knew in the Robotics Club about it.
I asked about what the situation was on the day\nthat Ageha was called for.
At the time, Ageha said it was decided that her\nteam would enter the contest, but she had kind of\na sad look about her.
I wonder if they said something... else to her?
Could it be that because she's in two clubs at\nthe same time, she's losing her position?
That's what I was worried about, so I asked about\nit. But apparently, there haven't really been any\ncomplaints from the other club members.
They said that there aren't many people in the\nRobotics Club who are as enthusiastic as her.
Anyway, the advisor to the Robot Club is\nTobioka-sensei, who I'd heard rumors about when\nwe were looking for members for our club.
He has a grudge against Amane, and it's said that\nhe sees the Soaring Club as enemies.
It's just a rumor, but it seems that this is what\nTobioka-sensei said to Ageha when she was called\nfor that day:
...We do not allow our members to hold positions\nin other clubs, you must quit one of them.
'...Then she stopped coming.'
Clatter...
Staring at the plans, Amane dropped her pen.
'...Sorry.'
Apologizing to no one in particular, she picks up\nthe pen.
Amane has also been acting a little strangely\nsince Ageha stopped coming.
She's been fidgeting and seems restless.
'Ageha said this would last until the local\nqualifiers for the Robotics Contest.'
'It sucks that the production of the main wings\nhas been slowed down, but let's wait until then.'
'But, if she's really thinking about quitting...'
'...I'd want her to tell us soon. We'll have to\nsearch for another member, after all.'
While she listlessly poked at her omelet, Kotori\nvoiced her complaints.
'What are you doing here?'
Suddenly, a man's deep voice called out.
Surprised, we turned to look at the door and saw\na middle-aged man standing there.
From the open door, we hear the patter of the\nrain pouring down, and feel the humidity coming\ninside.
'Tsk! It's him...'
Speak of the devil...
It's the Robotics Club advisor, Kujira\nTobioka-sensei.
'We are in the middle of the exams. Don't you\nknow that club activities are forbidden?'
'We know. That's why we're not doing club\nactivities.'
'What was that?'
'(Hey, don't get snarky with him like that!)'
'(But he's really irritating!)'
'We're eating our lunch and studying for\ntomorrow's exams.'
Tobioka-sensei stares straight at me.
He looks like he would never believe the words of\na student.
But I'm not lying.
'I've just transferred here, so there are many\nthings I don't know in the specialist subjects,\nso Mochizuki-senpai was teaching me.'
Kotori is also not too great with these\nspecialist subjects.
So the fact that we are here studying for our\nexams is a valid reason.
...Of course, having air conditioning is another\nreason.
'So you are the new members of the Soaring Club?'
He seems to have been convinced by what I said,\nbut now he's changed the question.
'Don't take this the wrong way, but you should\ngive up on this club.'
'What the hell are you trying to say?!'
'If you want to be involved in something, you\nshould join the Robotics Club.'
'Sir, why do you have to say something like\nthat?'
While trying to hold back Kotori, without\nthinking, I answered back angrily.
I was pretty annoyed though.
'Hmph. It is a teacher's duty to guide the\nstudents. I said the same thing to Miss Himegi.'
'(As I thought! He threatened Ageha!)'
'(I won't forgive him for this!)'
'(Hold it, calm down.)'
Kotori looked like she would charge her\nwheelchair into Tobioka if it wasn't for me\nholding her back.
'So what did she say?'
'That she would think about it for a while. Well,\nprovided that she isn't a complete idiot, there's\nonly one answer.'
'Even so, I'm keeping an eye on her. Among the\nmembers of our club, she is outstanding.'
'She won't quit! She's been working so hard on\nthis!'
'That is exactly why. If you're going to get\nseriously involved in something, it's better to\nchoose something that has a future.'
'That is to say, she should not choose a club\nthat has no goals, like this one.'
We have no goals!?
'We do have goals. We have clear objectives.'
'Yeah!'
As we answer back, Tobioka scoffs at us.

We don't take part in competitions, and we don't
make announcements of our work. Perhaps to a
teacher like him, it looks like we're just doing
this for fun.
'Also, it's useless for you to even try.'
'The Soaring Club will have its club status\nrepealed this summer.'
'Isn't that right, Mochizuki?'
'Wasn't that only if I was the only member?'
'Now, as you can see, Aoi and Kotori are here\ntoo...'
'A promise is a promise.'
As Amane tries to explain calmly, Tobioka\nforcefully interrupts her.
Then,
'I will have you keep that promise.'
He states, as if reminding her of something, then\nstorms out of the garage.
'What was that about, Amane?'
'Is it true that the club will lose its status?'
Once Tobioka had left, we both went over to\nAmane.
'Hmm... Tobioka-sensei has misunderstood the main\npoint of the promise.'
'Having the club close would be more like a side\neffect of keeping the promise.'
'What is this promise?'
'I'm leaving this summer.'
'Leaving...?'
We were stunned.
Stunned to hear about this so suddenly.
'But Amane, weren't you going to stay here for a\nlong time to come?'
That's what I thought too.
I thought she was going to stay here even after\nwe leave.
'I've already repeated the year more times than\nthe school allows. It's because I received\nspecial permission from the school.'
'Because of this, several promises were made.'
'The first is, that I would quit club activities\nthis summer, then graduate the following spring.'
'Quit... then graduate...'
'What about the club being closed...?'
'As I just said, that wasn't part of the promise.\nThat's Tobioka-sensei's misunderstanding.'
'For years, I've been doing this by myself. No\nnew members joined.'
'That's why the school is planning to close the\nSoaring Club the same year that I leave.'
Hearing about these things all of a sudden left\nme slightly confused.
'...Is that OK? For you to quit?'
'It's not a question of whether it's OK or not.\nThe school won't allow it, and I also made a\npromise to my father.'
The teachers, her father... all these promises\nshe's made with adults.
I don't know what all of those people were\nthinking when they made those promises.
But I do know that there are things that will be\nlost because of them.
'That's why, before then...'
Amane picked up the photo frame that was placed\non her desk.
The frame was once empty, but now has displays\nthe beautiful photograph of the passage of clouds\nbathed in the morning sun.
'...Before then, I want to go to this place.'
Amane stared at the photograph as if she were\nlooking at something far, far away.
'Since you came here, I started to think... that\njust maybe...'
'...this time, I would be able to reach it.'
...just maybe.
...this time.
Thinking of all the many months that Amane had\nspent in this garage, her words felt so full of\nmeaning.
Listening to her words, beside me, Kotori was\nquietly biting her lip.
'Aoi, what's up?'
'Is Ageha here?'
'Ageha? She went to the convenience store.'
'OK, thanks.'
'Why don't you call her?'
'No, it's OK. I want to speak to her face to\nface.'
'Hee hee hee! I have to give myself a little\ntreat for studying so hard!'
'By treat, I mean Hargen Darch Cookies & Cream!'
'Here I go!'
'You look like you're enjoying that.'
'Pfff!! Cough, cough!'
She let down her guard as she opened her mouth\nwide to stuff ice cream into it. Ageha choked\nfrom the force of spitting it out.
'A-...Aoi! Don't jump out at me!'
'Sorry. You should eat it at home.'
'It'll melt. Besides, it's luxurious to eat it\noutside like this. You want a spoonful, Aoi?'
'OK, I'll have a little.'
'OK, say 'Aaah...'!'
'Stop talking like that, will ya? It's\nembarrassing!'
I say that as I bite down on the spoon Ageha\noffers.
'Oh, that's nice. What flavor is this?'
'Cookies & Cream & Ageha Indirect Kiss flavor.'
'Sounds like there are some unneeded things in\nthere, but it tastes good.'
I'll try buying some of this next time.
'You could at least act a little embarrased. This\nis because we're childhood friends, isn't it?'
When we were kids, it was normal for us to share\njuice boxes and the like.
Now, it's more embarrassing to act shy about\nsharing something like ice cream.
In other words, I pretended to not be shy about\nit.
'So what are you doing here? Don't you need to\nstudy for tomorrow's exam?'
'I heard from Hotaru that you'd be here.'
'You went all the way to my house?'
'You mind if I have a bit more?'
'...Sure, go ahead.'
The rain that had been falling since this morning\nhas stopped in the evening. The stars shone\nbeautifully in the night sky.
It was humid but the breeze was cool.
We walked along the empty lakeside promenade, and\nI changed to another topic.
'I heard from someone in the Robotics Club.\nTobioka said something to you, didn't he?'
'Oh, you heard about that...'
'It's nothing. The school doesn't prohibit being\na member of two clubs at the same time. I don't\nthink it's anything to worry about.'
'I know, but...'
It's said that Tobioka is a pretty imposing guy,\neven amongst the teachers.
Being put in his sights is definitely bad.
'Well, I misjudged things a little.'
'Amane is in the Soaring Club, and I thought it\nwould be OK to sit back and watch, helping out\njust a little.'
'So that's why you thought it would be alright to\nbe in both clubs?'
Ageha nods.
'But I never thought she'd be that clumsy...\nAlso, Amane is kind of cute, so I like her!'
'Tobioka is the advisor to the Robotics Club,\nright? If you don't quit the Soaring Club, he'll\nforce you to leave the Robotics Club, won't he?'
'I guess that's how things will turn out. Ah\njeez, he told me to choose one or the other.'
'Ageha.'
'Please, don't quit.'
'...Which one?'
'The Soaring Club.'
'...of course.'
Ageha seems troubled by me bringing this up.
Holding onto the railing of the promenade, I lean\ntowards the lake.
Now that the rain has stopped, countless stars\nare projected on the calm surface of the lake.
'Hey, do you remember? Our secret base?'
'Huh? Oh, I remember.'
When I lived here before, outside Kazami Shopping\nStreet, in an alley that was hard for people to\nsee down, was a building that had been abandoned.
We made it our secret base, and we would all\ngather there and play.
'That was fun, wasn't it?'
'Yeah, we took all sorts of toys there, and we\ndecided to remodel the place.'
I think that most people must have made secret\nbases as kids.
But we were proud of our base because it was much\nbigger and better, well, anyway, it was cool.

One day, some bullies from the next neighborhood
came to take it away from us. We fought together
to ward them off... And various other things
happened there.
'Speaking of which, what happened to that\nabandoned building?'
'Windy Kazegaura was built on top of it.'
So that means it was swallowed in the first wave\nof redevelopment.
'What about it?'
'The atmosphere in the Soaring Club's garage.\nThey're similar, aren't they?'
'...It is, now that you mention it.'

Standing the back of the school grounds, it feels
like it's been forgotten by everyone. Inside,
Amane and the other Soaring Club members from
years gone by redecorated it as they saw fit.
It's a jumble of things that no one understands,\nit looks so chaotic. Yet, you really feel the\npresence of the people who have been there.
'That's why it's been so much fun lately.'
'It's been too much fun, so much that I've\ncompletely lost myself in it.'
'But I joined the Robotics Club because I enjoy\nit, and I'm really happy to enter the contest.'
'Yeah.'
I heard that Ageha has inspired the juniors who\nlacked motivation, and had helped their\nconstruction of their robot to proceed.
She has a responsibility to them too.
'I also want to do what I can for the sake of the\nseniors who are no longer able to enter.'
'That's my way of taking responsibility.'
'So, you're...'
'Yes. I'm going to quit after the contest.'
'...Is it OK for you to do that?'
This is what she wants, and it might sound a\nlittle strange to say this, but she looked like\nshe still had some kind of lingering attachment.
'It's fine. I enjoyed making robots though.'
'But I can't help it if I enjoy making gliders\ntoo, though!'
'Being able to make things alongside Amane really\nmotivates me!'
'You think so?'
'Yeah, I do. You should be a little more\nimpressed.'

Somehow, my first impression of her was so
strong, that rather of thinking of her as a
'great' person, the impression of her being an
'interesting' person wins in the end.
'The truth is... there's something else.'
This is what I really wanted to talk about.
'It looks like Amane's going to quit this\nsummer.'
'What...?'
'Today at lunchtime, Tobioka came to the garage.\nThen...'
I tell Ageha everything that happened at the\ngarage at lunchtime.
Our exchange with Tobioka, and about the promise\nwith Amane.
'Amane's gonna quit...'
'But she's been the Super Repeat Student for\nages! From now on, I thought she'd...'
'She said it was a promise to the teachers. Amane\nis planning to quit this summer.'
'...If you don't come back soon, I don't think\nwe'll make it in time.'
After the incident that day, Kotori and I wrote\nout the work schedule.

Based on the assumption that Ageha would come
back on the day we agreed on, we would just
barely be able to make it in time to do a test
flight during the summer holiday.
Never mind going to the 'passage of cloud'...
'I'm sorry. I know that what I'm saying is\nunreasonable.'
'But, I can't just keep quiet and tell you about\nit later.'
'Yeah...'
I'm aware that she's faced with a difficult\nchoice.
However, telling her when it is too late will\nonly make her feel worse.
That's why it's better to talk about it while\nthere is still hope.
'I see, so Amane's going to quit...?'
Ageha mumbled quietly while she tapped her\nfingers on her chin, deep in thought.
She paced one lap around the place, and then\nremembered her Hargen Darch and went back to eat\nit.
'Aww... It's melted...'
Ageha put the empty ice cream cup on top of the\nrailing, leaned over and looked down.
'...Well, Aoi, it's your turn.'
'Me?'
'Don't you want to talk about yourself, Aoi?'
'I don't think so... What is it?'
I was a little puzzled by this unexpected turn of\nevents.
Ageha looked up, straight at me. It was almost\nlike she was glaring at me.
'Aoi, why did you quit cycling?'
'Huh?'
Being asked out of the blue like that meant I\ncouldn't think of my 'model answer' right away.
'...That's... because there's no Cycle Racing\nClub here.'
'You don't need a club to get on a bike. You're\nstill interested in it, aren't you?'
'But you don't ride at all now.'
Ageha looks at me though she can see right\nthrough me. She knows I'm at a loss for an\nanswer.
'...Does it have anything to do with the accident\nyou had during your last race?'
'How do you know...?'
'I can check the results of the race on the\nInternet, you know.'
'I heard about your race from An-chan, and felt\nawful about not being able to go.'
'You were up on the podium, weren't you...?'
'That's why I was always checking the results of\nyour races on the Internet.'
That's what Masatsugu was talking about before.
...Ageha felt bad about it. ...That she couldn't\nsee you... at your best.
...You knew about that, didn't you?
At the time, I thought it was strange.
That Ageha hadn't asked me anything about my\ncycling.
If she felt bad about not being able to come and\nwatch, she should have been able to ask me, 'Why\ndon't you carry on?' like she is now.
'It said that there was an accident, and that you\nretired from the race.'
'So, why did you quit cycling? Why?'
Ageha, still looking up at me, stepped over a\npuddle and kept coming towards me.
'I was... injured. My knee...'
'That's why I couldn't carry on.'
'...Just as I thought.'
It wasn't just cycling.
She didn't really question whether or not that\nwas the reason for me changing school.
She knew that I don't want to talk about it, so\nshe didn't ask me.
'Why didn't you tell me?'
'I thought it was kinda lame. That I got injured\nand then came running back here...'
'It isn't lame.'
'It is lame.'
'It just sounds like I'm whining. I didn't want\nyou guys... to see that uncool side of me.'
'Oh, I think you're cool!'
'...What? Are you making fun of me?'
'Yep.'
'Why you...!'
She doesn't know how I felt about quitting\ncycling, or why I came back here...
'But you showed Kotori, didn't you? That 'lame'\nside of you?'
'...Wh-...Why did you have to bring that up?'
'That was kind of a wild guess. But it looks like\nyou did talk to her about it after all.'
'Well, that's...'
I don't know what to say, and Ageha gives me a\nsideways glare.
It's true that I hadn't told Ageha and the\nothers. When I told Kotori, I thought it was\nstrange.
Funnily enough, that conversation took place\nright where we are now.
Perhaps I told her because she had suffered a\nmuch worse injury than me. She had lost so much,\nand had felt so much despair.
Then, she couldn't stand it any more, and started\nto crack under the strain of it all.
As I felt myself getting even just a little\ncloser to her, I showed her the weakest side of\nmyself.
'I'm really sorry!'
PAH!
I gave a great big bow.
'Hmm? I can't hear you... I thought you were a\nsportsman!'
'I had my reasons! It's true, please believe me!'
'She said that she wanted to drop out of school,\nand I couldn't think of a way to persuade her to\nstay!'
'So in order to make her change her mind, you\nopened up and told her something that you\ncouldn't even tell me, your best friend?'
'Yes, that's right.'
'...Hey, Aoi.'
'Yes, what is it?'
'Are you and Kotori dating?'
'Huh?'
'You're always together, so that's how it looks.'
'If you're secretly dating, that would make me\nfeel kind of awkward. I might even have to quit\nthe Soaring Club.'
'You're wrong! That's not it at all!'
'So, do you like her?'
'Wh-...Wh-...Wh-...What are you talking about?'
'Your voice is breaking. That's suspicious.'
'If I didn't like her, I wouldn't spend so much\ntime with her.'
'Do you mean that girls and boys can't be\nfriends?'
I answered back like a child.
But I really don't see her that way.
'If you're asking about me and Kotori, then the\nsame goes for us two doesn't it?'
Actually, there are some people who do mistakenly\nthink that we are dating.
'Then what about you and Kotori? Just friends?'
'Yeah, just friends.'
'She's your number one closest friend these\ndays.'
I can't deny that.
'So you and I being best friends, is all in the\npast?'
'When it comes to friends, there is no number\none.'
'You don't get it, do you?'
'To me, the fact that you are my number one best\nfriend is very special to me.'
'That's how it's been since we were kids.'
'There's a big difference between being number\none or not.'
'If I were your number one best friend, you\ndefinitely would've told me about your injury.'
'To you perhaps... that wouldn't be embarassing,\nbut...'
'A guy who isn't shy about 'indirect kissing'\nlike you can't say anything. Could it be that you\ndon't even think of me as a girl?'
'Well, it's not that I wasn't shy... I was just\nembarrassed to show it, that's all.'
Is it possible that Ageha was the same?
'It would be better if you two started going out.\nThat way, I could make a big comeback as your\nnumber one best friend!'
'Call it what you like.'
'More importantly, let's talk about the club.'
I try to force the conversation back to the topic\nat hand after getting hugely sidetracked.
'Alright.'
'We're all worried that you are just going to\nquit if things carry on like this.'
'Kotori's angry about it, isn't she? Because I've\nbecome like this all of a sudden.'
'Yeah, a little.'
'But she said to Tobioka 'There's no way she\nwould quit!', speaking quite angrily.'
'No way, really? I wish I could've seen it for\nmyself.'
'Amane-senpai has also been acting weird. She's\nlost all her motivation since you stopped\ncoming.'
'Even Amane-senpai...?'
'That's why, even if you can't do it now, you've\ngotta come back.'
'...OK, thanks.'
Ageha looked kind of timid and embarrassed.
The final day of the end of term exams...
We feel a sense of liberation as the exam ends.\nThe mood in the classroom suddenly becomes bright\nand cheerful.
There's one more day left of the first term.
After the closing ceremony tomorrow, the summer\nholiday will finally begin.
'Aoi!'
Ageha, who was chatting with the girls in the\nclass about their plans for the summer holidays,\nstopped talking to come over to me.
'What's up?'
'There's something I want to talk to you about\nlater.'
'Can't talk now?'
'I've gotta do something after this.'
'Oh, the Robotics Club?'
'No. I was given a love letter. I have to respond\nto it.'
'What?'
Without thinking, my face stiffens up, and Ageha\ngrins delightedly in response.
'You should see your face! Are you worried that\nsomeone is going to take your childhood friend\naway from you?'
'See, now you know how I feel, don't you?'
'...How are you going to respond?'
I ask cautiously...
'Well now, I don't know until I hear what he has\nto say.'
'O-Okay... I wish you all the best!'
I decide to not get in her way any more than I\nalready have, and quickly leave the classroom.
'Well well, I'm more popular than I thought!'
'...Sorry to keep you waiting.'
'No, I just got here! Just kidding!'
'What a surprise! When I got here this morning,\nthere was a love letter in my desk.'
'Love letter?'
'Huh? That's not it? I thought someone was going\nto confess their love for me, and I was waiting\nhere, all excited.'
'...That's right.'
'Huh? Seriously?'
'Heee... hooo... heee... hooo... heee...'
'...Ageha, I know that you don't like me.'
'Huh?'
'If you tell me that you can't stand the sight of\nme, I'll leave.'
'But please don't quit the Soaring Club!'
'What!? What are you talking about?'
'Amane going through a lot! She made a promise to\nthat annoying teacher, Tobioka, and she has to\nquit the club this summer!!!'
'That's why we have to be able to fly before\nthen! No, not just fly, we have to fly above the\nclouds!'
'That's why we need your help!'
'It won't make much difference if I'm there or\nnot, but you're different.'
'If you're not there, we can't finish the wings!\nWe can't fly!'
'Amane has been trying so hard all this time...\nTo keep her promise to Isuka.'
'What that is, I don't know, but...'
'But, even so, aaaaaahhh...!!!'
'Anyway! I'm saying that if Amane can't fly, I\nwould feel so sorry for her!!!!!'
'Well, even if you get angry with me about it...'
'If you don't want me there, I'll quit right now!\nI won't go there anymore!'
'I'll even quit the school if need be!!'
'But, in return... I'd like you to stay in the\nSoaring Club...'
'Kotori...'
'Please.'
'I don't want to.'
'Wh-...Whaaaaaaat!!!?'
'Listen, I don't hate you, Kotori.'
'Well, sometimes you can be pretty annoying...\nAhem! Ahem!'
'Annoying...?'
'If you're saying that I should stay and you'll\nquit, then I refuse.'
'So, so... What should we do!?'
'You should stay and make the wings. I will help\nyou.'
'But... the problem is that we can't do that!'
'Kotori, do you hate me?'
'You can't stand the sight of me?'
'No, I don't think that. I guess you can\nsometimes be a pain in the... Ahem! No, it's\nnothing.'
'You were gonna say that I'm a pain in the ass,\nright?'
'I...I wasn't! I don't hate you as much as I did\nbefore. No, now I... like you.'
'You see, I can be kind of horrible, right? Don't\nyou think?'
'When I get like that, you can give me a karate\nchop. If it doesn't hurt, I won't remember.'
'That hurts...!! What are you doing!!!?'
'Ah, you just told to me do it...'
'Only when I'm being horrible! If you do that\nwhen I haven't done anything, you're just being\nviolent!'
'OK, I'll remember that.'
'...Ugh... Why are the all the people who were\nraised in this town so violent?'
'What were we talking about?'
'The Soaring Club!'
'Oh right. OK, let's go.'
'Huh? Where?'
'To the garage. I have a little suggestion.'
'Waaaaasup!'
'Waaaaasup!'
The two second-year girls came bursting in.
'Hey there.'
'Hey there, buddy.'
Ageha grins as she looks at me.
'What is it, Ageha? Don't you have to go to the\nRobotics Club?'
'Before that, there's something I want to talk to\nyou about.'
'(Kotori, did something happen?)'
'(I'm not sure. She has some sort of\nsuggestion...)'
'Ahem.'
Ageha clears her throat while glaring at Kotori\nand I whispering to each other.
'I heard that Amane will be leaving. There's not\nmuch time left.'
'Yeah...'
'But as I said a few days ago, I have to focus on\nthe Robotics Club for a while.'
'From today onwards, we'll be doing the last job\nfor preparing to go to the contest.'
'With the extension of club activity hours, we'll\nbe working as late as possible - right up until 8\nPM, probably every day.'
'So after you finish at the Robotics Club, you\ncan't even come and see us here?'
Ageha gives a solemn nod.
I guess this really is a hopeless situation for\nus.
'But I have a suggestion!'
'Let's have a camp!'
'Camp...?'
'That's right, camp!'
We don't see where she's going with this.
'Where are we gonna do that?'
'Here, of course!'
'We're going to stay here and work?'
Even though we live within walking distance?
'We don't actually have to stay here. All we have\nto do is submit a request to the student\ncouncil.'
'Then what are we going to do?'
Ageha grins and snickers.
'We can stay at school as long as we want!'
With that, it was like the light bulbs above our\nheads had finally lit up.
'I can come after eight o'clock but...'
'That'll be enough!'
'Yeah, we'll be able to work longer too, so the\nschedule will be much shorter!'
'Ah ha ha, you guys are the best. Usually people\nwould complain like 'My summer holiday is\nruined!''
'In the summer holidays, there's nothing to do\nexcept homework!'
'Why would we complain when we can do what we\nwant every day?'
'Uh-huh. What do you think, senpai?'
'Yeah, it's a good idea. But is that alright with\nyou...?'
'You're in two clubs at once, so you'll be busier\nthan any of us.'

'That's why I agree with what Aoi said. I can do
all the things I want at the same time, so if I
get a little worn out, I'm completely fine with
that.'
'So it's decided!'
'Let's submit our request to camp here to the\nstudent council right away!'
'Yeah, let's do that. While we're there, we can\nsubmit our notification of who will be second in\ncharge.'
Everyone looked like 'Oh yeah, there was that\ntoo...'.
'So, it's gonna be Aoi...'
'I think it should be you, Kotori.'
'Huh?'
'Yeah, that's what I thought too.'
'Wait, wait, what makes you think that?'
'I'm in two clubs at once, aren't I?'
'I've got my dorm mother's job to do, so I'll\npass.'
'Let's cast a vote. All those who think it should\nbe Kotori...!'
Everyone except Kotori quickly raised their\nhands.
'What? No way!'
'I'm the least useful, and I can't do anything by\nmyself...'
'That's alright, isn't it?'
'We humans were born without wings - but still,\nwe yearn to fly freely through the sky. It may\nseem impossible, but...'
'At times like this, the solution is not\ntechnology or talent... it's passion, I think.'
'The person second in charge must be someone who\nwants to fly through the sky. Someone who will\ntake everyone else with them.'
'Amane...'
'...But, isn't that your role, Amane? After all,\nyou are the club leader.'
'Well, it's already been decided.'
'OK, first things first, let's hand in those\nnotices to the student council.'
'Uhhh... You're just making me do all the stuff\nthat you guys don't wanna do, aren't you...?'
And in one fell swoop, we decided that we would\n'camp' in the garage. We even got a second in\ncommand.
'Ok, we'll be back soon.'
'See you soon.'
Kotori and Amane headed to the student council to\nsubmit the notices.
'OK then, I'm off to Robotics Club.'
'Ageha?'
'Hmm?'
'Thanks for sticking with us.'
'No problem. I'm doing it because I want to.'
'A-...Anyway, how was it?'
'What?'
'Y'know, that thing you were talking about... the\nlove letter?'
She grins again.
'He totally confessed his feelings for me!'
'Totally, you say... what kind of feelings?'
'That he likes me!'
'Well, that person was really forward. Nothing\nwrong with that, though.'
'So, did you agree to go out with him?'
'Yeah.'
'Oh... really? I'll be cheering for you!'
'Thanks! Well then, I'll be off now.'
'Yeah, good luck!'
And that's how our summer holiday began.
'...I wonder what kind of person he is?'
